section.name: About patterntesting-concurrent
section.p: Concurrency will become more and more important in the future. PatternTesting has some support for concurrency but has also have support for testing threads.

ul.li: Thread support: you can mark your methods as @Sychronized which has the advantage that the lock classes from java.util.concurrent will be used. This allows you more flexibility than the synchronized keyword.

section.name: History
section.p: In a previous version support for concurrency was distributed over several sub projects (patterntesting-rt and patterntesting-check).
